meanings.definition: A large number or quantity of people or things moving together.
meanings.sent1: The school children ran in droves to the playground for recess.
meanings.sent2: Tourists flocked in droves to the famous landmark to take pictures.
meanings.sent3: The ants worked together in droves to carry the food back to their nest.
meanings.sent4: The leaves fell from the tree in droves, covering the ground in a colorful blanket.
meanings.sent5: The shoppers arrived in droves at the store's grand opening, eager for discounts.

meanings.definition: To drive or urge in large numbers.
meanings.sent1: The coach droves the team to practice early in the morning.
meanings.sent2: The politician's speech droves the crowd to support his campaign.
meanings.sent3: The teacher droves the students to complete their homework on time.
meanings.sent4: The music droves the audience to get up and dance in excitement.
meanings.sent5: The leader's vision droves the community to work together for a common goal.
